definition: mythological figure (such as the Grim Reaper) in charge of taking the souls of those who die/(fig.) death

sentences.english: Charge deaths' God also will flinch. The happy flowers bloom everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 死神也忘而卻步，幸福之花處處開遍。

sentences.english: Death arrived at his house on the night of his demise.
sentences.chinese: 在男人即將死去的那個夜晚，死神來到了他的屋子。

sentences.english: Death's End. The title of the final installment gives away what is coming, but whose death?
sentences.chinese: 最終本的書名《死神永生》透露了結局，但誰的死亡？

sentences.english: A cat has nine lives. But the AZRAEL still take it away.
sentences.chinese: 貓有九條命，但它仍然會被死神帶走。

sentences.english: Do you know what it means to be loved by death?
sentences.chinese: 你可知道受死神眷戀是怎樣的？

sentences.english: And take a Life that wearies me.
sentences.chinese: 死神，把厭煩我的生命攫取。

sentences.english: How time flied. Death god came to Ali.
sentences.chinese: 時光飛逝，知道死神的到來。

sentences.english: You, like a god of death, mercilessly deprived the soul of the desperate.
sentences.chinese: 你，如同一位死神，無情地剝奪了絕望者的靈魂。

sentences.english: Death is abroad and children play.
sentences.chinese: 死神處處皆在，而孩子們在戲耍。

sentences.english: Nor shall death brag thou wanderest in his shade.
sentences.chinese: 死神也不能誇說你在他陰影裏徘徊。

sentences.english: So when he calls me, Death shall find me ready.
sentences.chinese: 所以死神將我召喚時此生無憾。

sentences.english: Six Shis thousand then lie to gush in the bosom of Azrael, is embraced by him.
sentences.chinese: 陸蒔千便躺倒在死神的懷裏，由他抱着。

sentences.english: Love HAs to not prevent god of death arrival, He abanfiniITdd IT to walk Number1.
sentences.chinese: 情感阻擋不了死神的降臨，他撇下她一個人先走了。

sentences.english: I cannot escape the Grim Reaper.
But, now we must welcome the Azrael to befallen.
sentences.chinese: 但現在，我們只有等待死神的降臨。

sentences.english: Lance, after all, is a man who cheated his own death, having survived testicular cancer.
sentences.chinese: 畢竟是一個欺騙了死神，從睾丸癌中倖存下來的人啊。

definition: Asura, malevolent spirits in Indian mythology
Lucifer (Satan's name before his fall in Jewish and Christian mythology)
